comments:
Ran a build file that produced a lot of warnings. Got one of the error for every warning.

java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: " warning"
at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException.java:48)
at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:468)
at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:518)
at org.eclipse.ant.internal.ui.console.JavacPatternMatcher.matchFound(JavacPatternMatcher.java:63)
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.console.PatternMatchListener.matchFound(PatternMatchListener.java:47)
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.console.ConsolePatternMatcher$MatchJob.run(ConsolePatternMatcher.java:130)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)

Bummer.
Works if you use the JDTCompilerAdapter.

Propose to fix for RC3

In fact we are totally failing to link / match warnings from the 
EclipseJavacPatternMatcher. The regex in the plugin.xml precludes this.

I am also getting these errors when compiling my project with Ant.  When the 
error occurs I get an internal error popup dialog, which is very annoying since 
I want to run the build in the background.  Is there any way to suppress the 
popups?
Window>Preference>Ant>Show error dialog when Ant build fails
That's what I thought... but it does not appear to be working.
*** Bug 100063 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 100101 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 100124 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

So I did a fairly major refactoring of this code:
Created AbstractJavacPatternMatcher to abstract out all the common code
EclipseJavacPatternMatcher, JavacPatternMatcher and JikesPatternMatcher all 
are subclasses now.

Fixed this specific bug in JavacPatternMatcher.matchFound... handles 
error/warning messages with ':' embedded

As well all matchers fail more gracefully if the linenumber string is not a 
linenumber string.

Also added a performance win: reuse of found IFiles...in other Ant land usages 
this was a performance bottleneck: ResourcesPlugin.getWorkspace().getRoot
().findFilesForLocation(IPath).

Also changes to the plugin.xml of org.eclipse.ant.ui so that Eclipse "javac" 
will match on warnings.
